com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit

Class CampaignKitManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit.CampaignKitManager

  • public class CampaignKitManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the primary entry point for the Campaign Kit subsystem.

    A CampaignKitManager instance is the primary interface for working with Campaign Kit cloud data. This provides access to Campaign objects and serves as the central registration point for notifications of related beacon/geofence events.

    For details about the available notifications see the CampaignKitNotifier.

    To initialize a Campaign Kit manager you will need the configuration settings for your kit. These can be downloaded from the Campaign Kit server as a .properties file. These settings can be loaded in any number of ways.

    For newer Android applications, the file can be added to the /assets folder. You can then use the following method to instantiate a CampaignKitManager as a singleton: 

      public class MyApplication extends Application implements CampaignKitNotifier {
     // Storage for an instance of the manager
     private static CampaignKitManager sCkManager = null;
     // Object to use as a thread-safe lock
     private static final Object sCkManagerLock = new Object();

     /**
      * Instantiate the Campaign Kit manager instance
      */
     @Override
     public void onCreate() {
         super.onCreate();
         synchronized (sCkManagerLock) {
             if (sCkManager == null) {
                 sCkManager = CampaignKitManager.getInstance(
                         getApplicationContext(),
                         loadConfig()
                 );
             }
         }
         sCkManager.setNotifier(this);
         sCkManager.start();
     }

     private Configuration loadConfig() {
         Properties properties = new Properties();
         try {
             properties.load(getAssets().open("CampaignKit.properties"));
         } catch (IOException e) {
             throw new IllegalStateException("Unable to load properties file!", e);
         }
         return new Configuration(properties);
     }
 }

    For older Android applications, or if you just prefer using Java resources, the file can be added to the /resources folder. You can still use the above method for creating a singleton instance. Simply replace the loadConfig() method with the following implementation: 

     private Configuration loadConfig() {
     Properties properties = new Properties();
     InputStream in = getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("CampaignKit.properties");
     if (in == null) {
         throw new IllegalStateException("Unable to find CampaignKit.properties files");
     }
     try {
         properties.load(in);
     } catch (IOException e) {
         throw new IllegalStateException("Unable to load properties file!", e);
     }
     return new Configuration(properties);
 }

    Of course you can store these properties any way you please. Just populate them into a Map instance and create a Configuration from it. Then provide this to the CampaignKitManager.getInstance(Context, Configuration) method.

    To receive callbacks when interesting things happen implement CampaignKitNotifier. And provide that instance to the manager via CampaignKitManager.setNotifier(CampaignKitNotifier).

    WARNING: the current design internally implements the CampaignKitManager as a singleton. Do NOT assume that this will always be the case. As per the example above we strongly recommend that you keep track of your own singleton instance. This way when the behavior does change your app will not be affected. Be aware that calling CampaignKitManager.getInstance(Context, Configuration) more than once will result in a AlreadyInitializedException being thrown.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    CampaignKitNotifier, Campaign

        @Deprecated
protected CampaignKitManager(Context context)
        Deprecated. Not for public use. As of 0.6.0, replaced by CampaignKitManager.getInstance(Context, Configuration).
        Creates an instance of CampaignKitManager using the default properties file.

        Not for public use.

        Parameters:
        context - An application Context for the internal services and storage systems.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the properties file cannot be found or loaded.
        java.util.InputMismatchException - If there was an error parsing the list of tags.
        MissingKeyException - If properties file does not contain one or more required keys.
        MissingValueException - If properties file contains null or an empty string for a required key value.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If context is null.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the value set for Configuration.CONFIG_SYNC_INTERVAL in the properties file cannot be parsed into a long.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstanceForApplication

        @Deprecated
public static CampaignKitManager getInstanceForApplication(Context context)
        Deprecated. As of 0.6.0, replaced by CampaignKitManager.getInstance(Context, Configuration).
        Creates an instance of CampaignKitManager using the default properties file.

        A context must be provided, but if you need to use it from a non-Activity or non-Service class, you can attach it to another singleton or a subclass of the Android Application class.

        Parameters:
        context - An application Context for the internal services and storage systems.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the properties file cannot be found or loaded.
        java.util.InputMismatchException - If there was an error parsing the list of tags.
        MissingKeyException - If properties file does not contain one or more required keys.
        MissingValueException - If properties file contains null or an empty string for a required key value.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If context is null.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the value set for Configuration.CONFIG_SYNC_INTERVAL in the properties file cannot be parsed into a long.

      • getInstance

        public static CampaignKitManager getInstance(Context appContext,
                             Configuration config)
        Creates an instance of CampaignKitManager.

        Sets up a stopped CampaignKitManager with the provided configuration.

        WARNING: this currently sets a singleton instance for the application. Do NOT assume that this will always be the case. However, since this returns a singleton calling it a 2nd time would result in undefined behavior as either appContext or config could contained different values. As such this currently throws AlreadyInitializedException on subsequent calls. We suggest you implement your own singleton in your application to prevent this exception and ease future upgrades.

        Parameters:
        appContext - An application Context for the internal services and storage systems.
        config - The configuration settings for the manager.
        Returns:
        An instance of CampaignKitManager configured according to config and associated with appContext.
        Throws:
        AlreadyInitializedException - If an instance has already been initialized with a configuration. Thrown on subsequent calls after the first instance if configured successfully.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If appContext or config are null.
        Since:
        0.6.0

      • getInstance

        @Deprecated
protected static CampaignKitManager getInstance()
        Deprecated. Not for public use. As of 0.6.0, replaced by CampaignKitManager.getInstance(Context, Configuration).

      • didDetermineStateForRegion

        public void didDetermineStateForRegion(int state,
                              ProximityKitBeaconRegion region)
        Called with a state value of MonitorNotifier.INSIDE when at least one beacon in a Region is visible. Called with a state value of MonitorNotifier.OUTSIDE when no beacons in a Region are visible.
        Parameters:
        state - either MonitorNotifier.INSIDE or MonitorNotifier.OUTSIDE
        region - a Region that defines the criteria of beacons to look for

      • disableGeofences

        public void disableGeofences()
        Disables the detection of geofences.

        Geofences are disabled by default.

      • enableGeofences

        public void enableGeofences()
                     throws GooglePlayServicesException
        Enables the detection of geofences.

        Geofences are disabled by default, since Google Play Services must be installed on the device for them to work.

        Example of use: 

         // `this` must be an application object, or use `getApplication()`
 CampaignKitManager ckManager = ProximityKitManager.getInstanceForApplication(this);
 try {
     ckManager.enableGeofences();
 } catch(GooglePlayServicesException gpse) {
     //Google Play Services not available on this device
     gpse.printStackTrace();
 } catch (Exception e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
 ckManager.start();
        Throws:
        GooglePlayServicesException

      • getFoundCampaigns

        public java.util.ArrayList getFoundCampaigns()
        Contains a list of all the campaigns that the app has found. This can be used to populate a ListView with all currently active campaigns that the app has encountered. This will return null prior to syncing.
        Returns:

      • removeCampaign

        public void removeCampaign(Campaign campaign)
        Removes Campaign from the list of triggered Campaigns. This will prevent the Campaign from being triggered for 60 seconds.

      • removeCampaign

        public void removeCampaign(java.lang.String id)
        Removes Campaign from the list of triggered Campaigns. This will prevent the Campaign from being triggered for 60 seconds.

      • setCampaignFulfilled

        public boolean setCampaignFulfilled(Campaign c,
                           Place p)
        Records a 'fulfilled' analytic for Campaign.

        Alternatively, fulfilled analytics may be recorded automatically by including Redemption Places when setting up your Campaigns on campaignkit.radiusnetworks.com. When a user has already found and viewed a Campaign, and then encounters a Redemption Place for that Campaign, then it will automatically be recorded as fulfilled.

        Parameters:
        c -
        p -
        Returns:

      • setCampaignViewed

        public boolean setCampaignViewed(Campaign campaign)
        Records a 'viewed' analytic for this Campaign.
        Parameters:
        campaign - the Campaign to mark as viewed if it is not already
        Returns:
        false if campaign has already been viewed or has not yet been marked found, true otherwise

      • setSyncInterval

        public void setSyncInterval(long milliseconds)
        Sets the length of time, in milliseconds, between syncs with the Campaign Kit server.

        In the event that a campaign is added or updated on the server, the app must sync in order to receive this new information. However, syncing does tax battery life if performed too often, so we do not recommend setting this very low.

        This is set to ms by default. The minimum setting is ms.

        If this is not set in the configuration, is set to null, or is the empty string then the default value is used.

        This does not change the value the managers base Configuration. Instead it updates the current wait time. This will be reset on the next app start.

        Parameters:
        milliseconds - Number of milliseconds to wait between each sync with the server.
        See Also:
        Configuration, Configuration.CONFIG_SYNC_INTERVAL

      • start

        public void start()
        Syncs data from CampaignKit, and once the sync is done, starts looking for iBeacons matching the beacon regions associated with the active campaigns in Campaign Kit, pre-enabling data callbacks to the CampaignKitNotifier.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop all Campaign Kit activities.

        This will:

        • Stop syncing to the cloud
        • Unregister all known geofences (if enabled)
        • Disconnect from the geofence service (if enabled)
        • Unregister all known beacons
        • Disconnect from the beacon service

      • sync

        public void sync()
        Forces a sync with the server to gather fresh Campaign data.

        To be used sparingly, since this taxes battery life of the user's device. For an alternate method, use setSyncInterval() instead. Syncing is set to occur once every hour by default.
        See Also:
        CampaignKitManager.setSyncInterval(long)
